title: Will the Tribunal ever come back?
body: I just miss the tribunal as I thought it was a good way of punishing players who were in the wrong.

replies.body:
tribunal 2.0 is a feature Riot is thinking about. Which will allow players to interact with honor system as well. But that is faaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaarrrrrrrrrrrr down the road. 

Further than the new client, further than solo ladder rewards, further than behavioral visibility improvements.

nah its not. if they really care how to punish someone they did better and that's when we dont need Tribunal system, but they didn't, they care about how to get more money, 1 or 2 ppl quit game it doesnt matter

Once players figured out that spamming BAN on all reports gave everyone else who spammed BAN extra IP, it really became a way to punish anybody who got reported.

Which meant the wanker in game who writes "GG nobb, reported" - and reports you, has the power to actually get you banned.

This community is too awful to be trusted with policing itself. :D

This is not true at all.  The people who spammed "ban" were easily detected.  In fact, Lyte said they had "fake cases" in order to help weed out those people.  Also, they stopped giving IP out pretty early on.  Eventually the majority of people participating were honest/good people.

Sorry, you're right- it switched over to the Justice Rating didn't it.

I do remember having a decent rating though, but was still very frustrated from the amount of "wrong" pardons I received due to people spamming the BAN button.

That said, reading some stuff now, they switched off the tribunal because the volume of cases outgrew the people still willing to do the work.
